footnotes.english_saheeh: [1043]- See footnote to 2:1.

translations.english_saheeh: Ṭā, Seen, Meem.[1043]
translations.english_hilali_khan: 1. Tâ-Sîn-Mîm.
translations.english_rwwad: Tā sīn mīm.

translations.english_saheeh: These are the verses of the clear Book.
translations.english_hilali_khan: These are the Verses of the manifest Book [(this Qur’ân), which was promised by Allâh in the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel), makes things clear].
translations.english_rwwad: These are the verses of the clear Book.

arabic_text: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: Perhaps, [O Muḥammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It may be that you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are going to kill yourself with grief, that they do not become believers [in your Risalah (Messengership) i.e. in your Message of Islâmic Monotheism].[1]
translations.english_rwwad: Perhaps you will grieve yourself to death because they do not believe.

arabic_text: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
phonetic: 26.4 'In Nasha' Nunazzil `Alayhim Mina As-Samā'i 'Āyatan Fažallat 'A`nāquhum Lahā Khāđi`īna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1044]- i.e., they would be compelled to believe.

translations.english_saheeh: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.[1044]
translations.english_hilali_khan: If We will, We could send down to them from the heaven a sign, to which they would bend their necks in humility.
translations.english_rwwad: If We willed, We could send down upon them a sign from the heaven, at which their necks would stay bowed in humility.

arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ
phonetic: 26.5 Wa Mā Ya'tīhim Min Dhikrin Mina Ar-Raĥmāni Muĥdathin 'Illā Kānū `Anhu Mu`riđīna

translations.english_saheeh: And no mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And never comes there unto them a Reminder as a recent revelation from the Most Gracious (Allâh), but they turn away therefrom.
translations.english_rwwad: No new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate except that they turn away from it.

arabic_text: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
phonetic: 26.6 Faqad Kadhabū Fasaya'tīhim 'Anbā'u Mā Kānū Bihi Yastahzi'ūn

translations.english_saheeh: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they have indeed denied (the truth - this Qur’ân), then the news of what they mocked at will come to them.
translations.english_rwwad: They have rejected [the Truth], soon there will come to them the consequences of their ridicule.

arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ
phonetic: 26.7 'Awalam Yaraw 'Ilá Al-'Arđi Kam 'Anbatnā Fīhā Min Kulli Zawjin Karīmin

translations.english_saheeh: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Do they not observe the earth - how much of every good kind We cause to grow therein?
translations.english_rwwad: Do they not see the earth, how many fine kinds of plants We grow in it?

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.8 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this is an Ayâh (proof or sign), yet most of them (polytheists, pagans who do not believe in Resurrection) are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them will not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

arabic_text: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 26.10 Wa 'Idh Nādá Rabbuka Mūsá 'Ani A'ti Al-Qawma Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (remember) when your Lord called Mûsâ (Moses) (saying): "Go to the people who are Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers) -
translations.english_rwwad: And [remember] when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people –

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allāh?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "The people of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh): Will they not fear Allâh and become righteous?"
translations.english_rwwad: the people of Pharaoh; will they not fear [the punishment of] Allah?”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "My Lord! Verily, I fear that they will belie me,
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, I fear that they may reject me,

arabic_text: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ
phonetic: 26.13 Wa Yađīqu Şadrī Wa Lā Yanţaliqu Lisānī Fa'arsil 'Ilá Hārūna

translations.english_saheeh: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And my breast straitens, and my tongue expresses not well. So send for Hârûn (Aaron) (to come along with me).
translations.english_rwwad: and I will feel distressed and my tongue will not be fluent, so send Aaron along [to help me].

arabic_text: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ

translations.english_saheeh: And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And they have a charge of crime against me, and I fear they will kill me."
translations.english_rwwad: Moreover, they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me.”

arabic_text: قَالَ كـَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
phonetic: 26.15 Qāla Kallā Fādh/habā Bi'āyātinā 'Innā Ma`akum Mustami`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Allâh) said: "Nay! Go you both with Our Signs. Verily We shall be with you, listening.
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said, “Certainly not! Go, both of you, with Our signs; We are with you, listening.

arabic_text: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
phonetic: 26.16 Fa'tiyā Fir`awna Faqūlā 'Innā Rasūlu Rabbi Al-`Ālamīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1045]- The singular form in Arabic indicates that both were sent with a single message.

translations.english_saheeh: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers[1045] of the Lord of the worlds,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And go both of you to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), and say: ‘We are the Messengers of the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
translations.english_rwwad: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are the messengers from the Lord of the worlds,

translations.english_saheeh: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So allow the Children of Israel to go with us.’ "
translations.english_rwwad: that you let the Children of Israel go with us.’”

arabic_text: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.18 Qāla 'Alam Nurabbika Fīnā Walīdāan Wa Labithta Fīnā Min `Umurika Sinīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said [to Mûsâ (Moses)]: "Did we not bring you up among us as a child? And you did dwell many years of your life with us.
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “Did we not bring you up as a child among us, and you stayed with us several years of your life?

arabic_text: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
phonetic: 26.19 Wa Fa`alta Fa`lataka Allatī Fa`alta Wa 'Anta Mina Al-Kāfirīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1046]- i.e., striking the Copt, who died as a result.

translations.english_saheeh: And [then] you did your deed which you did,[1046] and you were of the ungrateful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And you did your deed, which you did (i.e. the crime of killing a man) while you were one of the ingrates."
translations.english_rwwad: Yet you did what you did, and you are extremely ungrateful.”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray [i.e., ignorant].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Mûsâ (Moses) said: "I did it then, when I was ignorant (as regards my Lord and His Message).
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “I did it when I had no guidance.

arabic_text: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
phonetic: 26.21 Fafarartu Minkum Lammā Khiftukum Fawahaba Lī Rabbī Ĥukmāan Wa Ja`alanī Mina Al-Mursalīna

translations.english_saheeh: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me judgement [i.e., wisdom and prophet hood] and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord has granted me Hukm (i.e. religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood), and made me one of the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: So I fled from you in fear. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.

arabic_text: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

translations.english_saheeh: And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And this is the past favour with which you reproach me: that you have enslaved the Children of Israel."
translations.english_rwwad: Is this a favor that you remind me with, that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?

phonetic: 26.23 Qāla Fir`awnu Wa Mā Rabbu Al-`Ālamīna

translations.english_saheeh: Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) said: "And what is the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists)?"
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “What is ‘the Lord of the worlds’?”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.24 Qāla Rabbu As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Baynahumā 'In Kuntum Mūqinīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, if you seek to be convinced with certainty."
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if only you had sure faith.”

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said to those around: "Do you not hear (what he says)?"
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear [what he just said]?”

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Your Lord and the Lord of your ancient fathers!"
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1047]- Angrily addressing those present.

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said,[1047] "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Verily, your Messenger who has been sent to you is a madman!"
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “Your messenger who has been sent to you is truly insane!”

arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
phonetic: 26.28 Qāla Rabbu Al-Mashriqi Wa Al-Maghribi Wa Mā Baynahumā 'In Kuntum Ta`qilūna

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Lord of the east and the west, and all that is between them, if you did but understand!"
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “Lord of the east and west and all that is between them, if only you had sense!”

arabic_text: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ
phonetic: 26.29 Qāla La'ini Attakhadhta 'Ilahāan Ghayrī La'aj`alannaka Mina Al-Masjūnīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "If you choose an ilâh (god) other than me, I will certainly put you among the prisoners."
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “If you take any god other than me, I will throw you into prison.”

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you something [i.e., proof] manifest?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Even if I bring you something manifest (and convincing)?"
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “What if I bring you a clear proof?”

arabic_text: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
phonetic: 26.31 Qāla Fa'ti Bihi 'In Kunta Mina Aş-Şādiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "Bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “Bring it then, if you are truthful!”

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1048]- i.e., clearly genuine.

translations.english_saheeh: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.[1048]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So [Mûsâ (Moses)] threw his stick, and behold, it was a serpent, manifest.
translations.english_rwwad: So he threw down his staff, and suddenly it was a real serpent.

arabic_text: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
phonetic: 26.33 Wa Naza`a Yadahu Fa'idhā Hiya Bayđā'u Lilnnāžirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he drew out his hand, and behold, it was white to all beholders!
translations.english_rwwad: And he drew out his hand, and it was glowing white to the beholders.

arabic_text: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said to the chiefs around him: "Verily! This is indeed a well-versed sorcerer.
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “This is indeed a learned magician!

arabic_text: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ
phonetic: 26.35 Yurīdu 'An Yukhrijakum Min 'Arđikum Bisiĥrihi Famādhā Ta'murūna

translations.english_saheeh: He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "He wants to drive you out of your land by his sorcery: what is it then that you command?"
translations.english_rwwad: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic. What do you suggest?”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
phonetic: 26.36 Qālū 'Arjihi Wa 'Akhāhu Wa Ab`ath Fī Al-Madā'ini Ĥāshirīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Put him off and his brother (for a while), and send callers to the cities;
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch heralds to the cities

translations.english_saheeh: Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "To bring up to you every well-versed sorcerer."
translations.english_rwwad: to bring you every learned magician.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1049]- i.e., the morning of the day of festival.  See 20:58-59.

translations.english_saheeh: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.[1049]
translations.english_hilali_khan: So the sorcerers were assembled at a fixed time on a day appointed.
translations.english_rwwad: So the magician were assembled at an appointed time on a known day.

translations.english_saheeh: And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it was said to the people: "Are you (too) going to assemble?
translations.english_rwwad: And it was said to the people, “Will you join the gathering,

arabic_text: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
phonetic: 26.40 La`allanā Nattabi`u As-Saĥarata 'In Kānū Humu Al-Ghālibīna

translations.english_saheeh: That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "That we may follow the sorcerers [who were on Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) religion of disbelief] if they are the winners."
translations.english_rwwad: so that we may follow the magicians if they are victorious?”

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
phonetic: 26.41 Falammā Jā'a As-Saĥaratu Qālū Lifir`awna 'A'inna Lanā La'ajrāan 'In Kunnā Naĥnu Al-Ghālibīna

translations.english_saheeh: And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: So when the sorcerers arrived, they said to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh): "Will there surely be a reward for us if we are the winners?"
translations.english_rwwad: When the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, “Will there be a reward for us if we are victorious?”

arabic_text: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Yes, and you shall then verily be of those brought near (to myself)."
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Yes, and then you will surely be of those who are close to me.”

arabic_text: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Mûsâ (Moses) said to them: "Throw what you are going to throw!"
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said to them, “Throw whatever you wish to throw.”

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
phonetic: 26.44 Fa'alqaw Ĥibālahum Wa `Işīyahum Wa Qālū Bi`izzati Fir`awna 'Innā Lanaĥnu Al-Ghālibūna

translations.english_saheeh: So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said: "By the might of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh), it is we who will certainly win!"
translations.english_rwwad: So they threw their ropes and staffs, and said, “By the glory of Pharaoh, it is we who will be the victorious!”

arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ
phonetic: 26.45 Fa'alqá Mūsá `Aşāhu Fa'idhā Hiya Talqafu Mā Ya'fikūna

translations.english_saheeh: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then Mûsâ (Moses) threw his stick, and behold, it swallowed up all that they falsely showed!
translations.english_rwwad: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it swallowed up all objects of their illusion.

translations.english_saheeh: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allāh].
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the sorcerers fell down prostrate.
translations.english_rwwad: So the magicians fell down in prostration.

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We believe in the Lord of the worlds,

translations.english_saheeh: The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "The Lord of Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron)."
translations.english_rwwad: the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

arabic_text: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
phonetic: 26.49 Qāla 'Āmantum Lahu Qabla 'An 'Ādhana Lakum 'Innahu Lakabīrukumu Al-Ladhī `Allamakumu As-Siĥra Falasawfa Ta`lamūna La'uqaţţi`anna 'Aydiyakum Wa 'Arjulakum Min Khilāfin Wa La'uşallibannakum 'Ajma`īna

translations.english_saheeh: [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Fir‘aun (Pharaoh)] said: "You have believed in him before I give you leave. Surely, he indeed is your chief, who has taught you magic! So verily, you shall come to know. Verily, I will cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify you all."
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission. Indeed, he is your master who taught you magic, but you will soon come to know. I will surely cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then I will crucify you all.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "No harm! Surely, to our Lord (Allâh) we are to return.
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “No harm; we will surely return to our Lord.

arabic_text: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.51 'Innā Naţma`u 'An Yaghfira Lanā Rabbunā Khaţāyānā 'An Kunnā 'Awwala Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily we really hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers [in Mûsâ (Moses) and in the Monotheism which he has brought from Allâh]."
translations.english_rwwad: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, as we are the first of the believers.”

arabic_text: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We revealed to Mûsâ (Moses), saying: "Depart by night with My slaves, verily you will be pursued."
translations.english_rwwad: We inspired Moses, “Leave with My slaves by night; you will surely be pursued.”

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1050]- Recruiters of an army to prevent the emigration of the Children of Israel.

translations.english_saheeh: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers[1050]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) sent callers to (all) the cities.
translations.english_rwwad: So Pharaoh sent heralds to the cities,

translations.english_saheeh: [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Saying): "Verily these indeed are but a small band.
translations.english_rwwad: saying, “These are but a small band,

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, they are enraging us,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And verily, they have done what has enraged us.
translations.english_rwwad: and they have enraged us,

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, we are a cautious society..."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "But we are a host all assembled, amply fore-warned."
translations.english_rwwad: but we are all well-prepared.”

translations.english_saheeh: So We removed them from gardens and springs
translations.english_hilali_khan: So, We expelled them from gardens and springs,
translations.english_rwwad: Thus did We drive them out of their gardens and springs,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1051]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) caused them to abandon their wealth and property in pursuit of the Israelites.

translations.english_saheeh: And treasures and honorable station[1051] -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Treasures, and every kind of honourable place.
translations.english_rwwad: and their treasures and splendid dwellings.

translations.english_saheeh: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus [We turned them (Pharaoh’s people) out] and We caused the Children of Israel to inherit them.
translations.english_rwwad: So it was; and We made the Children of Israel to inherit them.

translations.english_saheeh: So they pursued them at sunrise.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they pursued them at sunrise.
translations.english_rwwad: They pursued them at sunrise.

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ
phonetic: 26.61 Falammā Tarā'á Al-Jam`āni Qāla 'Aşĥābu Mūsá 'Innā Lamudrakūna

translations.english_saheeh: And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Mûsâ (Moses) said: "We are sure to be overtaken."
translations.english_rwwad: When the two groups saw each other, the companions of Moses said, “We are surely overtaken!”

arabic_text: قَالَ كـَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

translations.english_saheeh: [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: [Mûsâ (Moses)] said: "Nay, verily with me is my Lord. He will guide me."
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “Certainly not! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”

arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
phonetic: 26.63 Fa'awĥaynā 'Ilá Mūsá 'Ani Ađrib Bi`aşāka Al-Baĥra Fānfalaqa Fakāna Kullu Firqin Kālţţawdi Al-`Ažīmi

translations.english_saheeh: Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We revealed to Mûsâ (Moses) (saying): "Strike the sea with your stick." And it parted, and each separate part (of that sea water) became like huge mountain.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We inspired Moses, “Strike the sea with your staff,” so it parted, each part became like a huge mountain.

translations.english_saheeh: And We advanced thereto the others [i.e., the pursuers].
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We brought near the others [Fir‘aun’s (Pharaoh) party] to that place.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We brought the others [pursuers] close to that place,

translations.english_saheeh: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We saved Mûsâ (Moses) and all those with him.
translations.english_rwwad: and We saved Moses and all those who were with him,

translations.english_saheeh: Then We drowned the others.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We drowned the others.
translations.english_rwwad: then We drowned the others.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.67 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily in this is indeed a sign (or a proof), yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: And recite to them the news of Abraham,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And recite to them the story of Ibrâhîm (Abraham).
translations.english_rwwad: Relate to them the story of Abraham,

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
phonetic: 26.70 'Idh Qāla Li'abīhi Wa Qawmihi Mā Ta`budūna

translations.english_saheeh: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: When he said to his father and his people: "What do you worship?"
translations.english_rwwad: when he said to his father and his people, “What do you worship?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "We worship idols, and to them we are ever devoted."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “We worship idols and remain devoted to them.”

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Do they hear you, when you call on (them)?
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Do they hear you when you call upon them?

translations.english_saheeh: Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Or do they benefit you or do they harm (you)?"
translations.english_rwwad: Or can they benefit or harm you?”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "(Nay) but we found our fathers doing so."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “No, but this is what we found our forefathers doing.”

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Do you observe that which you have been worshipping -
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “Do you see what you have been worshiping,

translations.english_saheeh: You and your ancient forefathers?
translations.english_hilali_khan: "You and your ancient fathers?
translations.english_rwwad: you and your ancestors?

arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1052]- The people worshipped idols in addition to Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,[1052]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily they are enemies to me, save the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, they are my enemies, except the Lord of the worlds,

translations.english_saheeh: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Who has created me, and it is He Who guides me.
translations.english_rwwad: Who created me, so He guides me;

phonetic: 26.79 Wa Al-Ladhī Huwa Yuţ`imunī Wa Yasqīni

translations.english_saheeh: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And it is He Who feeds me and gives me to drink.
translations.english_rwwad: and it is He Who provides me with food and drink;

translations.english_saheeh: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And when I am ill, it is He who cures me.
translations.english_rwwad: and when I am ill He heals me;

translations.english_saheeh: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And Who will cause me to die, and then will bring me to life (again).
translations.english_rwwad: and He will cause me to die then bring me back to life;

arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
phonetic: 26.82 Wa Al-Ladhī 'Aţma`u 'An Yaghfira Lī Khaţī'atī Yawma Ad-Dīni

translations.english_saheeh: And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And Who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Recompense, (the Day of Resurrection).
translations.english_rwwad: and I hope that He will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”

arabic_text: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
phonetic: 26.83 Rabbi Hab Lī Ĥukmāan Wa 'Alĥiqnī Biş-Şāliĥīna

translations.english_saheeh: [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: My Lord! Bestow Hukm (religious knowledge, right judgement of the affairs and Prophethood) on me, and join me with the righteous.
translations.english_rwwad: “My Lord, grant me knowledge, and join me with the righteous,

arabic_text: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
phonetic: 26.84 Wa Aj`al Lī Lisāna Şidqin Fī Al-'Ākhirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And grant me a mention [i.e., reputation] of honor among later generations.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And grant me an honourable mention in later generations.
translations.english_rwwad: and grant me an honorable mention among the later generations,

phonetic: 26.85 Wa Aj`alnī Min Warathati Jannati An-Na`īmi

translations.english_saheeh: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And make me one of the inheritors of the Paradise of Delight.
translations.english_rwwad: and make me of those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss;

arabic_text: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
phonetic: 26.86 Wa Aghfir Li'abī 'Innahu Kāna Mina Ađ-Đāllīna

translations.english_saheeh: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And forgive my father, verily he is of the erring.
translations.english_rwwad: and forgive my father, for he is one of those who have gone astray;

translations.english_saheeh: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And disgrace me not on the Day when (all the creatures) will be resurrected.
translations.english_rwwad: and do not disgrace me on the Day when all will be resurrected –

arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ
phonetic: 26.88 Yawma Lā Yanfa`u Mālun Wa Lā Banūna

translations.english_saheeh: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children
translations.english_hilali_khan: The Day whereon neither wealth nor sons will avail,
translations.english_rwwad: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any avail,

arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: But only one who comes to Allāh with a sound heart."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except him who brings to Allâh a clean heart [clean from Shirk (polytheism) and Nifâq (hypocrisy)]."
translations.english_rwwad: except the one who comes to Allah with a sound heart.”

translations.english_saheeh: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Paradise will be brought near to the Muttaqûn (the pious - See V.2:2).
translations.english_rwwad: Paradise will be brought near to the righteous,

translations.english_saheeh: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the (Hell) Fire will be placed in full view of the erring.
translations.english_rwwad: and Hellfire will be uncovered to those who went astray,

arabic_text: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ
phonetic: 26.92 Wa Qīla Lahum 'Ayna Mā Kuntum Ta`budūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it will be said to them: "Where are those (the false gods whom you used to set up as rivals with Allâh) that you used to worship.
translations.english_rwwad: and they will be told, “Where are those whom you used to worship

arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ
phonetic: 26.93 Min Dūni Allāhi Hal Yanşurūnakum 'Aw Yantaşirūna

translations.english_saheeh: Other than Allāh? Can they help you or help themselves?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Instead of Allâh? Can they help you or (even) help themselves?"
translations.english_rwwad: other than Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”

translations.english_saheeh: So they will be overturned into it [i.e., Hellfire], they and the deviators
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they will be thrown on their faces into the (Fire), they and the Ghâwûn (devils, and those who were in error).
translations.english_rwwad: Then they will be hurled into Hell one upon another, along with those who led them astray,

translations.english_saheeh: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And the whole hosts of Iblîs (Satan) together.
translations.english_rwwad: and the followers of Iblīs, all together.

translations.english_saheeh: They will say while they dispute therein,
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will say while contending therein,
translations.english_rwwad: There the deviants will say while quarreling with their false deities,

arabic_text: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

translations.english_saheeh: "By Allāh, we were indeed in manifest error
translations.english_hilali_khan: By Allâh, we were truly in a manifest error,
translations.english_rwwad: “By Allah, we were clearly misguided,

translations.english_saheeh: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: When We held you (false gods) as equals (in worship) with the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists);
translations.english_rwwad: when we deemed you equal to the Lord of the worlds.

translations.english_saheeh: And no one misguided us except the criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And none has brought us into error except the Mujrimûn [Iblîs (Satan) and those of human beings who commit crimes, murderers, polytheists, oppressors].
translations.english_rwwad: None led us astray except the wicked.

translations.english_saheeh: So now we have no intercessors
translations.english_hilali_khan: Now we have no intercessors,
translations.english_rwwad: Now we neither have any intercessors,

translations.english_saheeh: And not a devoted friend.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Nor a close friend (to help us).
translations.english_rwwad: nor a close friend.

arabic_text: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.102 Falaw 'Anna Lanā Karratan Fanakūna Mina Al-Mu'uminīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1053]- The conclusion of this verse is estimated as "...we would do this or that."

translations.english_saheeh: Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers..."[1053]
translations.english_hilali_khan: (Alas!) If we only had a chance to return (to the world), we shall truly be among the believers!
translations.english_rwwad: If only we had a chance to return, we would be among the believers.”

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.103 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, your Lord, He is truly the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is surely the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1054]- See footnote to 25:37.

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Noah denied the messengers[1054]
translations.english_hilali_khan: The people of Nûh (Noah) belied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of Noah rejected the messengers

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When their brother Nûh (Noah) said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
translations.english_rwwad: when their brother Noah said to them, “Do you not fear Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
translations.english_rwwad: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: I seek of you no reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds;

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So keep your duty to Allâh, fear Him and obey me."
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.”

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Shall we believe in you, when the meanest (of the people) follow you?"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Shall we believe in you when you are followed by the lowest people?”

arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
phonetic: 26.112 Qāla Wa Mā `Ilmī Bimā Kānū Ya`malūna

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "And what knowledge have I of what they used to do?
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “What knowledge do I have of what they do?

arabic_text: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Their account is only with my Lord, if you could (but) know.
translations.english_rwwad: Their reckoning is only with my Lord, if you realize!

translations.english_saheeh: And I am not one to drive away the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And I am not going to drive away the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: I am not going to drive the believers away.

translations.english_saheeh: I am only a clear warner."
translations.english_hilali_khan: I am only a plain warner."
translations.english_rwwad: I am only a clear warner.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ
phonetic: 26.116 Qālū La'in Lam Tantahi Yā Nūĥu Latakūnanna Mina Al-Marjūmīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "If you cease not, O Nûh (Noah) you will surely be among those stoned (to death)."
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “O Noah, if you do not desist, you will certainly be stoned.”

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "My Lord! Verily, my people have belied me.
translations.english_rwwad: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.

arabic_text: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.118 Fāftaĥ Baynī Wa Baynahum Fatĥāan Wa Najjinī Wa Man Ma`ī Mina Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Therefore judge You between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me."
translations.english_rwwad: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers who are with me.”

arabic_text: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
phonetic: 26.119 Fa'anjaynāhu Wa Man Ma`ahu Fī Al-Fulki Al-Mashĥūni

translations.english_saheeh: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
translations.english_rwwad: So We saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then We drowned the rest (disbelievers) thereafter.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We drowned thereafter all the rest.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.121 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, your Lord is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: ʿAad denied the messengers
translations.english_hilali_khan: ‘Âd (people) belied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of ‘Ād rejected the messengers

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: When their brother Hūd said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When their brother Hûd said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
translations.english_rwwad: when their brother Hūd said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
translations.english_rwwad: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn, and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1055]- i.e., a symbol or indication of their wealth and power.  They used to build lofty structures along the road to be seen by all who passed by.

translations.english_saheeh: Do you construct on every elevation a sign,[1055] amusing yourselves,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Do you build high palaces on every high place, while you do not live in them?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you build a landmark on every high place for no purpose?

translations.english_saheeh: And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses] that you might abide eternally?
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And do you get for yourselves palaces (fine buildings) as if you will live therein for ever.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: And do you construct for yourselves palaces, hoping that you will live forever?

translations.english_saheeh: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And when you seize (somebody), seize you (him) as tyrants?
translations.english_rwwad: And when you attack [others], do you attack ruthlessly?

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: So fear Allah, and obey me.

translations.english_saheeh: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And keep your duty to Him, fear Him Who has aided you with all (good things) that you know.
translations.english_rwwad: And fear the One Who has provided you with everything you know:

translations.english_saheeh: Provided you with grazing livestock and children
translations.english_hilali_khan: "He has aided you with cattle and children.
translations.english_rwwad: Who provided you with livestock and children,

translations.english_saheeh: And gardens and springs.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And gardens and springs.
translations.english_rwwad: and with gardens and springs.

arabic_text: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily, I fear for you the torment of a Great Day."
translations.english_rwwad: I fear for you the punishment of a momentous day.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ
phonetic: 26.136 Qālū Sawā'un `Alaynā 'Awa`ažta 'Am Lam Takun Mina Al-Wā`ižīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "It is the same to us whether you preach or be not of those who preach.
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “It is the same to us whether you admonish us or not.

translations.english_saheeh: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "This is no other than the false tales and religion of the ancients, [Tafsir At-Tabarî]
translations.english_rwwad: This is nothing but the custom of the former people,

translations.english_saheeh: And we are not to be punished."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And we are not going to be punished."
translations.english_rwwad: and we will never be punished.”

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.139 Fakadhabūhu Fa'ahlaknāhum 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So they belied him, and We destroyed them. Verily in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Thus they rejected him, so We destroyed them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe,

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: Thamūd denied the messengers
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thamûd (people) belied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of Thamūd rejected the messengers

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When their brother Sâlih said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
translations.english_rwwad: when their brother Sālih said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
translations.english_rwwad: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.

translations.english_saheeh: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Will you be left secure in that which you have here?
translations.english_rwwad: Will you be left secure in whatever you have here,

translations.english_saheeh: Within gardens and springs
translations.english_hilali_khan: "In gardens and springs.
translations.english_rwwad: in gardens and springs,

phonetic: 26.148 Wa Zurū`in Wa Nakhlin Ţal`uhā Hađīmun

translations.english_saheeh: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And green crops (fields) and date-palms with soft spadix.
translations.english_rwwad: and in fields of crops and date-palms laden with tender fruit,

phonetic: 26.149 Wa Tanĥitūna Mina Al-Jibāli Buyūtāan Fārihīna

translations.english_saheeh: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And you hew out in the mountains, houses with great skill.
translations.english_rwwad: carving out houses in the mountains with great skill?

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: So fear Allah, and obey me.

translations.english_saheeh: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And follow not the command of Al-Musrifûn [i.e. their chiefs: leaders who were polytheists, criminals and sinners],
translations.english_rwwad: And do not obey the command of the transgressors,

arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ
phonetic: 26.152 Al-Ladhīna Yufsidūna Fī Al-'Arđi Wa Lā Yuşliĥūna

translations.english_saheeh: Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Who make mischief in the land, and reform not."
translations.english_rwwad: those who spread corruption in the land and never do what is right.”

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "You are only of those bewitched!
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “You are but one of those who are bewitched!

arabic_text: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
phonetic: 26.154 Mā 'Anta 'Illā Basharun Mithlunā Fa'ti Bi'āyatin 'In Kunta Mina Aş-Şādiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "You are but a human being like us. Then bring us a sign if you are of the truthful."
translations.english_rwwad: You are but a human like us, so bring a sign if you are one of the truthful.”

arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
phonetic: 26.155 Qāla Hadhihi Nāqatun Lahā Shirbun Wa Lakum Shirbu Yawmin Ma`lūmin

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1056]- Miraculously sent to them as a sign by Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "This is a she-camel.[1056] For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "Here is a she-camel: it has a right to drink (water), and you have a right to drink (water) (each) on a day, known.
translations.english_rwwad: Sālih said, “This is a she-camel; she will have her share of water and you will have yours, each on a specified day.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
phonetic: 26.156 Wa Lā Tamassūhā Bisū'in Faya'khudhakum `Adhābu Yawmin `Ažīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And touch her not with harm, lest the torment of a Great Day should seize you."
translations.english_rwwad: Do not touch her with harm, or you will be seized by the punishment of a horrible day.”

translations.english_saheeh: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they killed her, and then they became regretful.
translations.english_rwwad: But they hamstrung her, then they became regretful,

arabic_text: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.158 Fa'akhadhahumu Al-`Adhābu 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So the torment overtook them. Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: So the punishment seized them. Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: The people of Lot denied the messengers
translations.english_hilali_khan: The people of Lût (Lot) (-who dwelt in the town of Sodom in Palestine) belied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of Lot rejected the messengers,

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When their brother Lût (Lot) said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh and obey Him?
translations.english_rwwad: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Verily I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
translations.english_rwwad: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1057]- i.e., Are there, out of all Allāh's creatures, any besides you who commit this unnatural act?

translations.english_saheeh: Do you approach males among the worlds[1057]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Go you in unto the males of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind),
translations.english_rwwad: Do you approach males with lust among all people,

arabic_text: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ
phonetic: 26.166 Wa Tadharūna Mā Khalaqa Lakum Rabbukum Min 'Azwājikum Bal 'Antum Qawmun `Ādūna

translations.english_saheeh: And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And leave those whom Allâh has created for you to be your wives? Nay, you are a trespassing people!"
translations.english_rwwad: leaving the wives whom your Lord has created for you? You are but a transgressing people.”

arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ
phonetic: 26.167 Qālū La'in Lam Tantahi Yā Lūţu Latakūnanna Mina Al-Mukhrajīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "If you cease not O Lût (Lot)! verily, you will be one of those who are driven out!"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “O Lot, If you do not desist, you will surely be expelled.”

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "I am, indeed, of those who disapprove with severe anger and fury your (this evil) action (of sodomy).
translations.english_rwwad: Lot said, “I utterly abhor your practice.

translations.english_saheeh: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "My Lord! Save me and my family from what they do."
translations.english_rwwad: My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequences of] what they do.”

translations.english_saheeh: So We saved him and his family, all,
translations.english_hilali_khan: So We saved him and his family, all,
translations.english_rwwad: So We saved him and all his family,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1058]- Lot's wife, who had collaborated with the evildoers.

translations.english_saheeh: Except an old woman[1058] among those who remained behind.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except an old woman (his wife) among those who remained behind.
translations.english_rwwad: except an old woman who was among those who remained behind.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We destroyed the others.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then afterward We destroyed the others.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We destroyed the rest,

arabic_text: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We rained on them a rain (of torment). And how evil was the rain of those who had been warned!
translations.english_rwwad: and We poured down upon them a rain [of stones]. How terrible was the rain of those who were warned!

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.174 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: The companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] denied the messengers
translations.english_hilali_khan: The dwellers of Al-Aikah [near Madyan (Midian)] belied the Messengers.
translations.english_rwwad: The people of the Forest rejected the messengers.

arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: When Shuʿayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
translations.english_hilali_khan: When Shu‘aib said to them: "Will you not fear Allâh (and obey Him)?
translations.english_rwwad: When Shu‘ayb said to them, “Will you not fear Allah?

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "I am a trustworthy Messenger to you.
translations.english_rwwad: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

translations.english_saheeh: So fear Allāh and obey me.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So fear Allâh, keep your duty to Him, and obey me.
translations.english_rwwad: so fear Allah, and obey me.

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

translations.english_saheeh: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "No reward do I ask of you for it (my Message of Islâmic Monotheism); my reward is only from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists).
translations.english_rwwad: I do not ask you for any reward for this; my reward is only with the Lord of the worlds.

arabic_text: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ
phonetic: 26.181 'Awfū Al-Kayla Wa Lā Takūnū Mina Al-Mukhsirīna

translations.english_saheeh: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "Give full measure, and cause no loss (to others).
translations.english_rwwad: Give full measure and do not be of those who defraud others,

translations.english_saheeh: And weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And weigh with the true and straight balance.
translations.english_rwwad: and weigh with accurate scales,

arabic_text: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
phonetic: 26.183 Wa Lā Tabkhasū An-Nāsa 'Ashyā'ahum Wa Lā Ta`thaw Fī Al-'Arđi Mufsidīna

translations.english_saheeh: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And defraud not people by reducing their things, nor do evil, making corruption and mischief in the land.
translations.english_rwwad: and do not defraud people of their goods, nor go about in the land spreading corruption.

phonetic: 26.184 Wa Attaqū Al-Ladhī Khalaqakum Wa Al-Jibillata Al-'Awwalīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1059]- i.e., previous generations.

translations.english_saheeh: And fear He who created you and the former creation."[1059]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And fear Him Who created you and the generations of the men of old."
translations.english_rwwad: And fear the One Who created you and the former peoples.”

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "You are only one of those bewitched!
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “You are truly bewitched!

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
phonetic: 26.186 Wa Mā 'Anta 'Illā Basharun Mithlunā Wa 'In Nažunnuka Lamina Al-Kādhibīna

translations.english_saheeh: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: "You are but a human being like us and verily, we think that you are one of the liars!
translations.english_rwwad: You are only a human being like us, and we think you are nothing but a liar.

arabic_text: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
phonetic: 26.187 Fa'asqiţ `Alaynā Kisafāan Mina As-Samā'i 'In Kunta Mina Aş-Şādiqīna

translations.english_saheeh: So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "So cause a piece of the heaven to fall on us, if you are of the truthful!"
translations.english_rwwad: So cause pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if you are of the truthful.”

translations.english_saheeh: He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."
translations.english_hilali_khan: He said: "My Lord is the Best Knower of what you do."
translations.english_rwwad: Shu‘ayb said, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”

arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ
phonetic: 26.189 Fakadhabūhu Fa'akhadhahum `Adhābu Yawmi Až-Žullati 'Innahu Kāna `Adhāba Yawmin `Ažīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But they belied him, so the torment of the day of shadow (a gloomy cloud) seized them. Indeed that was the torment of a Great Day.
translations.english_rwwad: Thus they rejected him, so they were seized by the punishment of the cloudy day; it was the punishment of a horrible day.

arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.190 'Inna Fī Dhālika La'āyatan Wa Mā Kāna 'Aktharuhum Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, there is a sign in this, yet most of them would not believe.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily your Lord, He is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: Your Lord is indeed the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And truly, this (the Qur’ân) is a revelation from the Lord of the ‘Âlamîn (mankind, jinn and all that exists),
translations.english_rwwad: This is indeed a revelation from the Lord of the worlds,

translations.english_saheeh: The Trustworthy Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down
translations.english_hilali_khan: Which the trustworthy Rûh [Jibrîl (Gabriel)] has brought down
translations.english_rwwad: which the Trustworthy Spirit [Gabriel] has brought down

translations.english_saheeh: Upon your heart, [O Muḥammad] - that you may be of the warners -
translations.english_hilali_khan: Upon your heart (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) that you may be (one) of the warners,
translations.english_rwwad: to your heart [O Prophet] so that you may be one of the warners,

translations.english_saheeh: In a clear Arabic language.
translations.english_hilali_khan: In the plain Arabic language.
translations.english_rwwad: in clear Arabic language.

translations.english_saheeh: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And verily, it (the Qur’ân, and its revelation to Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) is (announced) in the Scriptures [i.e. the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] of former people.
translations.english_rwwad: And it was indeed [mentioned] in the scriptures of the former peoples.

arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ

footnotes.english_hilali_khan: (V.26:197) See the footnote of (V.5:66) [The story about ‘Abdullâh bin Salâm رضي الله عنه].

translations.english_saheeh: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Is it not a sign to them that the learned scholars (like ‘Abdullâh bin Salâm رضي الله عنه who embraced Islâm)[1] of the Children of Israel knew it (as true)?
translations.english_rwwad: Was it not a proof for them that the learned men of the Children of Israel recognized it [to be true]?

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1060]- i.e., the non-Arabs or those who are not fluent in the Arabic language.

translations.english_saheeh: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners[1060]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if We had revealed it (this Qur’ân) unto any of the non-Arabs,
translations.english_rwwad: If We had sent it down to any of the non-Arabs,

arabic_text: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1061]- As a miracle from Allāh.

translations.english_saheeh: And he had recited it to them [perfectly],[1061] they would [still] not have been believers in it.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And he had recited it unto them, they would not have believed in it.
translations.english_rwwad: and he had recited it to them, still they would not have believed in it.

translations.english_saheeh: Thus have We inserted it [i.e., disbelief] into the hearts of the criminals.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Thus have We caused it (the denial of the Qur’ân) to enter the hearts of the Mûjrimûn (criminals, polytheists, sinners).
translations.english_rwwad: This is how We made it [disbelief] enter the hearts of the wicked.

arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
phonetic: 26.201 Lā Yu'uminūna Bihi Ĥattá Yaraw Al-`Adhāba Al-'Alīma

translations.english_saheeh: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They will not believe in it until they see the painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,

phonetic: 26.202 Faya'tiyahum Baghtatan Wa Hum Lā Yash`urūna

translations.english_saheeh: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It shall come to them of a sudden, while they perceive it not.
translations.english_rwwad: which will come upon them suddenly when they least expect it.

translations.english_saheeh: And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then they will say: "Can we be respited?"
translations.english_rwwad: They will then say, “Can we be granted some respite?”

translations.english_saheeh: So for Our punishment are they impatient?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Would they then wish for Our Torment to be hastened on?
translations.english_rwwad: Do they really seek to hasten Our punishment?

translations.english_saheeh: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
translations.english_hilali_khan: Tell Me, (even) if We do let them enjoy for years,
translations.english_rwwad: Tell me [O Prophet] if We give them a life of ease for years,

translations.english_saheeh: And then there came to them that which they were promised?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And afterwards comes to them that (punishment) which they had been promised,
translations.english_rwwad: then there came to them what they were warned of,

arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
translations.english_hilali_khan: All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.
translations.english_rwwad: what would avail them the life of ease that they were given?

arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
phonetic: 26.208 Wa Mā 'Ahlaknā Min Qaryatin 'Illā Lahā Mundhirūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
translations.english_hilali_khan: And never did We destroy a township but it had its warners
translations.english_rwwad: We never destroyed any town without sending them warners,

translations.english_saheeh: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
translations.english_hilali_khan: By way of reminder, and We have never been unjust.
translations.english_rwwad: to admonish them, for We are never unjust.

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1062]- As was asserted by the disbelievers.  Rather, it was brought by Gabriel, the Trustworthy Spirit.

translations.english_saheeh: And the devils have not brought it [i.e., the revelation] down.[1062]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And it is not the Shayâtîn (devils) who have brought it (this Qur’ân) down.
translations.english_rwwad: This [Qur’an] is not sent down by the devils,

phonetic: 26.211 Wa Mā Yanbaghī Lahum Wa Mā Yastaţī`ūna

translations.english_saheeh: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Neither would it suit them, nor they can (produce it).
translations.english_rwwad: it is not for them to do this, nor is it within their capability,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1063]- As mentioned in 72:9.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.[1063]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily, they have been removed far from hearing it.
translations.english_rwwad: for they are strictly barred from overhearing it.

arabic_text: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ
phonetic: 26.213 Falā Tad`u Ma`a Allāhi 'Ilahāan 'Ākhara Fatakūna Mina Al-Mu`adhabīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1064]- Or "worship."

translations.english_saheeh: So do not invoke[1064] with Allāh another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So invoke not with Allâh another ilâh (god) lest you should be among those who receive punishment.
translations.english_rwwad: So do not call upon any other god besides Allah, lest you become of those who will be punished.

footnotes.english_hilali_khan:
(V.26:214) Narrated Ibn ‘Abbâs رضي الله عنهما: When the Verse: "And warn your tribe (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of near kindred." (V.26:214) was revealed, Allâh’s Messenger صلى الله عليه وسلم went out, and when he had ascended As-Safa mountain, he shouted, "Yâ Sabâhâh!*" The people said, "Who is that?" "Then they gathered around him, whereupon he said, "Do you see? If I inform you that cavalrymen are proceeding up the side of this mountain, will you believe me?" They said, "We have never heard you telling a lie." Then he said, "I am a plain warner to you of a coming severe punishment." Abû Lahab said: "May you perish! You gathered us only for this reason?" Then Abû Lahab went away. So Sûrat Al-Masad "Perish the hands of Abû Lahab!" (V.111:1) was revealed. (Sahih Al-Bukhari, Vol.6, Hadîth No.495).
* "Yâ Sabâhâh!" is an Arabic expression used when one appeals for help or draws the attention of others to some danger.

translations.english_saheeh: And warn, [O Muḥammad], your closest kindred.
