translations.english_hilali_khan: And warn your tribe (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) of near kindred.[1]
translations.english_rwwad: And warn [starting with] the nearest kinsfolk,

arabic_text: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 26.215 Wa Akhfiđ Janāĥaka Limani Attaba`aka Mina Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to those who follow you of the believers.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And be kind and humble to the believers who follow you.
translations.english_rwwad: and lower your wing [in kindness] to the believers who follow you.

arabic_text: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ

translations.english_saheeh: And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then if they disobey you, say: "I am innocent of what you do."
translations.english_rwwad: But if they disobey you, say, “I disown what you do.”

translations.english_saheeh: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
translations.english_hilali_khan: And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,
translations.english_rwwad: And put your trust in the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1065]- From your bed at night for prayer while you are alone.

translations.english_saheeh: Who sees you when you arise[1065]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who sees you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) when you stand up (alone at night for Tahajjud prayers).
translations.english_rwwad: Who sees you when you stand up [for prayer],

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1066]- i.e., among those who pray with you in congregation.

translations.english_saheeh: And your movement among those who prostrate.[1066]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And your movements among those who fall prostrate (to Allâh in the five compulsory congregational prayers).
translations.english_rwwad: and your movements among those who prostrate.

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Verily He, only He, is the All-Hearer, the All-Knower.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

arabic_text: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

translations.english_saheeh: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Shall I inform you (O people!) upon whom the Shayâtîn (devils) descend?
translations.english_rwwad: Shall I inform you upon who the devils descend?

translations.english_saheeh: They descend upon every sinful liar.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They descend on every lying, sinful person.
translations.english_rwwad: They descend upon every sinful liar,

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1067]- This was before they were prevented, as described in 72:8-9.

translations.english_saheeh: They pass on what is heard,[1067] and most of them are liars.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Who gives ear (to the devils and they pour what they may have heard of the Unseen from the angels), and most of them are liars.
translations.english_rwwad: who whisper hearsay in the ears, but most of them are liars.

translations.english_saheeh: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
translations.english_hilali_khan: As for the poets, the erring ones follow them,
translations.english_rwwad: As for poets, they are followed by the deviants.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1068]- Speaking lies indiscriminately and praising and disparaging others according to whim.

translations.english_saheeh: Do you not see that in every valley they roam[1068]
translations.english_hilali_khan: See you not that they speak about every subject (praising people - right or wrong) in their poetry?
translations.english_rwwad: Do you not see that they wander aimlessly in every valley,

translations.english_saheeh: And that they say what they do not do? -
translations.english_hilali_khan: And that they say what they do not do.
translations.english_rwwad: and that they say what they do not do?

arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
phonetic: 26.227 'Illā Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Wa `Amilū Aş-Şāliĥāti Wa Dhakarū Allāha Kathīrāan Wa Antaşarū Min Ba`di Mā Žulimū Wa Saya`lamu Al-Ladhīna Žalamū 'Ayya Munqalabin Yanqalibūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [1069]- By replying through poetry to the attacks of hostile poets.

translations.english_saheeh: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allāh often and defend [the Muslims][1069] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Except those who believe (in the Oneness of Allâh - Islâmic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds, and remember Allâh much, and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged [by replying back in poetry to the unjust poetry (which the pagan poets utter against the Muslims)]. And those who do wrong will come to know by what overturning they will be overturned.
translations.english_rwwad: Except those who believe, do righteous deeds, remember Allah much and defend themselves after being wronged. The wrongdoers will come to know what end awaits them.
